title: Lew Hoad
summary: Lewis Alan Hoad (23 November 1934 â€“ 3 July 1994) was an Australian tennis player whose career ran from the early 1950s through the early 1970s. Hoad won four Major singles tournaments as an amateur (Australian Open, French Open and two Wimbledons). He was a member of the Australian team that won the Davis Cup four times between 1952 and 1956. Hoad turned professional in July 1957. He won the Kooyong Tournament of Champions in 1958 and the Forest Hills Tournament of Champions in 1959. He won the Ampol Open Trophy world series of tournaments in 1959, which included the Kooyong tournament that concluded in early January 1960. Hoad's men's singles tournament victories spanned from 1951 to 1971.  During his career his main competitors were his longtime amateur teammate Ken Rosewall and, throughout his professional career, Pancho Gonzales.
